definition: when the same fact is stored multiple times in several places in a database
The DBMS ensures multiple copies of the same data are consistent (EX: if a new record w/ StudentNum=8 is stored in the database, the DBMS ensures StudentName=Smith in that record.

When the DBMS DOES NOT ensure that multiple copies of the same data are consistent. EX: if a new record w/ studentNum = 8, is added and the student associatedd with it's StudentNAme = Smith, if the name listed in the new record was not SMmith, this would be an uncontrolled redundancy

term: How to see relationships between records of a database?
definition: Look at all the attributes and/or table headers, they will list all the recordds its related to
a request to the database Ex: give me the course# for Discrete Math
a change to the data in the database Ex: add a new student (list all attributes needed to make a new sstudent, name, course num, etc)
protocols a table's data columns must follow EX: student identification #s must be unique (key constraint), EX: A course id # listed in a section record must ACTUALLY exist in some course record
